New Records: Freddie Freeman claimed the World Series MVP trophy with a World Series record 12 RBIs and four home runs.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers came back from a five-run deficit, which no team in the 120-year history of the World Series had ever done in a clinching game.
Freddie Freeman hit a two-run single and Teoscar Hernandez hit a game-tying double.
Walker Buehler recorded the first-ever save of his career on one day of rest.
Freddie Freeman’s walk-off grand slam in Game 1 set the tone for the series.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers opened the season in Seoul, South Korea against the San Diego Padres.
Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter was accused of stealing $17 million dollars of the superstar’s money to pay off sports gambling debts.
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Dave Roberts highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Magic Johnson emphasized the significance of the victory for the city of Los Angeles.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers' victory marked their eighth championship in franchise history.
The Dodgers had a 33-inning scoreless streak in the NLCS, a postseason record.
The Dodgers set a postseason record for walks (42) and runs (46, 6.7/per game) in a series.
